In exercise of the powers, conferred by Section SA of the Aircraft Act, 1934
(XXII of 1934), delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil
Aviation Notification No, 1797 dated July 3, 1997, the Commissioner of Security,
Civil Aviation, for the purpose of security of the aircraft operations, directs that
security controls pertaining to Registered Baggage, details of which are given
below, shall be implemented for all international airline operators by Indian airlines
at IGI airport ( International Terminal) and by Air India at Chatrapati Shivaji
International airport, Mumbai ( International Terminal).

(i) Screening of Registered Baggage as per the procedure prescribed by
BCAS,

(ii) Surveillance of the Registered Baggage, after screening, up to check-in
counter,

(iii) Reconciliation/ Identification of baggage,

(iv) Security of baggage on conveyor belt,

(v) Security of baggage in the make-up area; and up to loading into the
aircraft,

(vi) Security of mishandled / transit /transfer/interline baggage,

(vii) Ensuring that only security controlled baggage is loaded into the
aircraft

This order shall come into force with immediate effect.
